business.headline: Budget 2025: Expectations for personal income tax reforms and moreThe middle-income group is looking forward to personal income tax revisions to ease their financial burden in the upcoming budget.

Budget 2025: 3 key expectations of homebuyersThe housing sector plays an important role in India's GDP and employment generation, raising hopes for reforms to reduce costs and promote homeownership.

Sensex up 500 points, Nifty continues positive run. What investors should doStock market today: The Sensex hit an intraday high of 76,991.05 and was trading 463.37 points higher at 76,963 at 10:55 am. The Nifty50 also rose 110.40 points to 23,286.45.

Adani Green share price surges over 6% in early trade. What's driving the rally?Adani Green share price: At 10:20 am, the stock was trading 3.28% higher at Rs 1,040.60, continuing its positive momentum after jumping as much as 19% in the previous session.

Explained: Why Biocon shares surged 7% today Biocon share price: The stock has gained 9.66% in the last month, 7.99% over the past six months, and an impressive 37.98% in the last year.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Inadvertent error: Meta apologises for Mark Zuckerberg's 2024 poll loss remarkMeta apology: The apology by Meta India comes a day after BJP MP Nishikant Dubey, who heads the parliamentary panel on IT, said it would summon the company's officials over Zuckerberg's remark.

Would've been arrested in...: Rahul Gandhi on RSS chief's independence remarkRahul Gandhi, addressing workers after the inauguration of the new Congress headquarters, said Mohan Bhagwat's remarks were an insult to freedom fighters and an attack on the Constitution.

Supreme Court pauses arrest of ex-IAS Puja Khedkar in UPSC cheating caseThe Supreme Court has paused the arrest of ex-IAS Puja Khedkar in a case linked to fraudulently availing reservation benefits under the OBC and disability quotas in the Civil Services Examination.

Budget 2025: Is merging old and new income tax regimes a good idea?Will merging the old and new tax regimes offer the best of both worlds for taxpayers? Experts weigh in on whether a unified system could simplify compliance or introduce new challenges.

How RSS has impacted vastu of new Congress headquartersAfter five decades at 24, Akbar Road, the Congress has moved to a new headquarters, Indira Bhawan, a kilometre from the BJP head office at Deen Dayal Upadhyay Marg. Wary of having an office on a road named after the long-dead RSS ideologue, the Congress is using its back door as the main entrance. It has preferred Kotla to Upadhyay.

Smriti Mandhana smashes India's fastest hundred in women's ODIsIndia vs Ireland, 3rd ODI: Smriti Mandhana broke Harmanpreet Kaur's record for the fastest hundred by an Indian batter in women's ODI cricket. Smriti also became only the fourth cricketer to score 10 or more hundreds in women's ODis.

How BJP and Congress have given Kejriwal a free passDespite over a decade to regroup, the BJP and Congress have failed to produce a leader who can challenge AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal on his turf, Delhi. Now, weeks before the Assembly polls, with no credible leadership in sight, Kejriwal continues to capitalise on a vacuum left by the BJP and Congress, in his bid to retain power in Delhi.
India's obesity guidelines updated after 15 years: What's changed?Indian doctors have redefined obesity with new guidelines that consider the unique health challenges faced by the population.

Elon Musk reacts to Donald Trump's pic with Coca-Cola CEO James QuinceyTrump, known for his love for Diet Coke, was pictured holding a commemorative bottle featuring a custom label reading 'Inauguration of President of the United States Donald J Trump'.

Navy gets 'hunter-killer' submarine, warships; PM says emerging as maritime powerIn a ceremony held at Mumbai's Naval Dockyard, PM Modi dedicated the three combatants -- INS Surat, INS Nilgiri and INS Vaghsheer -- to the nation.

Indian-origin nurse stabbed in the neck with scissors at UK hospitalAchamma Cherian, a 57-year-old Indian-origin nurse, was stabbed in the neck with a pair of scissors while on duty at Oldham Royal Hospital in the UK. Mohammed Roman Haque has been charged with attempted murder and possession of a bladed article. Cherian remains critically injured in hospital.

ED gets nod to prosecute Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia in liquor policy caseIn an order last November, the Supreme Court said that the ED has to take prior sanction before prosecuting public servants.
The following month, the probe agency wrote to VK Saxena, saying that granting of a sanction should be given since Kejriwal was the "kingpin and key conspirator" of the scam.

'How is this not God?' California man's home spared as wildfire burns block. VideoIn the viral video, the man walks through the ruins of his neighbourhood, explaining the destruction surrounding his intact home.

Never engaged in non-consensual sex: Author Neil Gaiman on rape claimsThe allegations against the 64-year-old acclaimed author of "The Sandman" comic book series and novel "American Gods" came to light after an article in the New York Magazine detailed the allegations of sexual assault, abuse and coercion.

Djokovic breaks Federer's all-time Grand Slam record, storms into 3rd roundAustralian Open 2025: Novak Djokovic won his 430th match at Grand Slams, going past Roger Federer's all-time mark. The Serb overcame a scare from 21-year-old Jaime Faria of Portugal to reach the third round.
Moment SpaceX deployed two lunar landers in space to go to the MoonThe two landers, named Blue Ghost and Resilience, are on distinct missions aimed at different lunar regions.

Anushka-Virat to host a housewarming party in Alibaug? Viral video sparks buzzAnushka Sharma and Virat Kohli are set to host a housewarming party at their new Alibaug home. A viral video featured pooja essentials being taken by the jetty to their new home.

Oscars 2025 to get cancelled due to wildfires? Here's what we knowSeveral reports claimed Oscars 2025 is on the brink of being cancelled due to the Los Angeles wildfires. However, there is no such credibility to the reports and for now, the ceremony is expected to take place on March 2.
Video: Pub owner opens fire, clashes with guards in Greater Noida apartmentGaurav Sisodia, the accused, allegedly fired at a security guard of a Greater Noida apartment following a parking dispute.

Are Sofia Vergara, Lewis Hamilton dating? Photos of lunch date go viralActor Sofia Vergara and Formula One superstar Lewis Hamilton were clicked enjoying a lunch date in New York. Their viral pictures have sparked dating rumours.

Over 300 flights delayed, trains hit as dense fog reduces visibility in DelhiDelhi weather: Due to zero visibility reported in parts of Delhi-NCR, at least 26 trains were delayed due to the dense fog conditions in Delhi and parts of northern India. Similarly, 329 flights were delayed due to the dense fog at the Delhi airport.

Volkswagen van that US man bought in whim miraculously survives Los Angeles fireA Volkswagen van survived the deadly Los Angeles fire that has claimed the lives of at least 29 people and destroyed over 12,000 structures.

Ignored Manmohan Singh: BJP attacks Congress for naming new office Indira BhawanAhead of the inauguration of the building, posters were seen outside the new Congress headquarters demanding that it be named 'Sardar Manmohan Singh Bhavan'.

Exclusive: Ranbir Kapoor's Dhoom 4 looks for an antagonist in SouthBollywood star Ranbir Kapoor will be playing the lead role in the highly-anticipated Dhoom 4. Now, as per sources, makers are looking to cast a popular South star as the villain.

Amar Upadhyay shuts down Ram Kapoor's criticism of his career choices: Don't care…Actor Amar Upadhyay responded to Ram Kapoor's remarks about his career choices, clarifying that he never left television. He stated he has been working actively since 2003 and focuses on ignoring negativity.

Priyanka Chopra to star with Jonas Brothers in holiday film: ReportGlobal icon Priyanka Chopra will reportedly be starring alongside her husband Nick Jonas and his brothers in a holiday film premiering on Disney in 2025. The film promises a memorable season with appearances from Frankie Jonas and actor Chloe Bennet.

Guardiola's animated chat with Ortega: City boss reveals what he told goalkeeperManchester City boss Pep Guardiola revealed what he told his goalkeeper Stefan Ortega after their draw against Brentford on Tuesday, January 14. Ortega was unable to prevent Brentford from scoring the equaliser in stoppage time.

Rishabh Pant leads 3-way battle for wicketkeeper slot in India squadChampions Trophy 2025: KL Rahul became India's preferred wicketkeeper in ODIs during Rishabh Pant's absence, but concerns over his ability to keep wickets for long periods arose after the 2023 World Cup. Pant's left-handed batting adds valuable variety to the middle order, making him a strong contender for India's first-choice keeper for the 50-over tournament.

Australian Open: Alcaraz asks if he is 'serve bot' after 14 aces vs NishiokaCarlos Alcaraz hilariously asked if he was a 'serve bot' after his incredible win over Japan's Yoshihito Nishioka in the second round of the Australian Open on Wednesday, January 15. Alcaraz served up a barrage of aces which stunned Nishioka in Melbourne.

R Ashwin breaks silence on retirement call, not getting farewell TestFormer India off-spinner R Ashwin said believed he was capable of representing India for a longer period than he ultimately did, but maintained his stance against farewell matches.

Hours after shock PSL retirement, Pakistan pacer Ihsanullah makes U-turnJust hours after making his shock retirement from the Pakistan Super League, pacer Ihsanullah has performed a U-turn. The 22-year-old said that he had made the call in the heat of the moment.

Australian Open: Olympic champion Zheng stunned, Mirra Andreeva survives scareThe Olympic champion and last year's runner-up, Zheng Qinwen, suffered a shock exit at the hands of Laura Siegemund on Day 4 of the Australian Open. Mirra Andreeva had to dig deep to overcome a scare by Japan's Moyuka Uchijima to progress to the third round.

Liverpool held to draw by Nottingham Forest, Manchester City let 2-goal lead slipLiverpool were forced to salvage a 1-1 draw against a resolute Nottingham Forest side, while Manchester City let a 2-0 lead slip to be held 2-2 draw by a determined Brentford on Tuesday, January 14 in the Premier League. Chelsea were able to secure a point against Bournemouth, while Graham Potter secured his first win as West Ham United manager.

Aakash Chopra questions India's T20 World Cup hero's absence in England seriesFormer India cricketer turned commentator, Aakash Chopra, has questioned the absence of India all-rounder Shivam Dube in the team for the upcoming T20I series against England.

Donyell Malen joins Aston Villa on permanent deal from Borussia DortmundAston Villa bolstered their attacking options by signing Dutch forward Donyell Malen from Borussia Dortmund for 23 million euros, with add-ons. Malen's experience and versatility are expected to strengthen Villa's push for European qualification and domestic success.

Steve Smith on being stuck at 9999 runs: Was thinking about Hazlewood's shirt noStar Australia batter Steve Smith opened up getting stuck at 9999 runs in Test cricket and revealed how he just kept thinking about Josh Hazlewood's jersey number ahead of the game.

Manu Bhaker likely to get 'deteriorating' Paris Olympics medals replacedIndia's star shooter Manu Bhaker is likely to receive replacements for her deteriorating Paris Olympics bronze medals, as the organising committee collaborates with Monnaie de Paris to address widespread medal quality concerns reported by numerous athletes worldwide.

Australian Open 2025, Day 4 schedule: Alcaraz, Djokovic and Bhambri in actionThe Day 4 of the Australian Open 2025 will have several big names of tennis world in action as Novak Djokovic, Carlos Alcaraz, Aryna Sabalenka and Coco Gauff amongst others will be seen on the court.

Premier League clubs avoid Profit and Sustainability charges for 2021-2024 periodNo Premier League clubs have been charged with Profit and Sustainability (PSR) breaches for the three-year reporting period between 2021 and 2024.

PV Sindhu makes winning return, Satwik-Chirag survive tough testIndia Open 2025: PV Sindhu, Kiran George, Dhruv Kapila and Tanisha Crasto, along with the men's doubles pair of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty, advanced to the second round. Sindhu defeated Sung Shuo Yun of Chinese Taipei in straight games, while Kiran survived a tense battle against Japan's Yushi Tanaka.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
